intro: Burasaia gracilis, commonly known as the slender burasaia, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by distinctive, elongated fruit capsules. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, with three leaflets that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. Burasaia gracilis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
